body:
So recently some junk got onto my computer somehow.

AVG found 1 out of 2 of the junk to be a virus.
I researched the other crap to find out that it was some what of a PUP.
The junk was called "iLivid" and I want to know if I should remove it or not.
body_tagged:
So recently some junk got onto my computer somehow.

AVG found 1 out of 2 of the junk to be a virus.
I researched the other crap to find out that it was some what of a PUP.
The junk was called "iLivid" and I want to know if I should remove it or not.
title: PUP Help

replies.body: Yes, remove it. iLivid is PUP.
replies.body_tagged: Yes, remove it. iLivid is PUP.

replies.body:
In the PC World, a PUP is a Potentially Unwanted Programming, such as adware, toolbars, and browser hijackers.
Not as dangerous as a virus but still can cause a bit of damage.
replies.body_tagged:
In the PC World, a PUP is a Potentially Unwanted Programming, such as adware, toolbars, and browser hijackers.
Not as dangerous as a virus but still can cause a bit of damage.

replies.body: iLivid somehow was downloaded on my computer some time ago, that's when adware and unwanted toolbars started to popup. I recommend uninstalling it completely.
replies.body_tagged: iLivid somehow was downloaded on my computer some time ago, that's when adware and unwanted toolbars started to popup. I recommend uninstalling it completely.

replies.body: Whenever I click a download button on MediaFire, I usually see my file save that I wanted to download, but also a separate window with iLivid saying it will install in "this amount of seconds"
replies.body_tagged: Whenever I click a download button on MediaFire, I usually see my file save that I wanted to download, but also a separate window with iLivid saying it will install in "this amount of seconds"

replies.body: I've had a couple of experiences with iLivid, on my clients' computers, and my own as well. I would recommend you uninstall it somehow, since it does lead to a ton of ads popping up everywhere.
replies.body_tagged: I've had a couple of experiences with iLivid, on my clients' computers, and my own as well. I would recommend you uninstall it somehow, since it does lead to a ton of ads popping up everywhere.

replies.body: a gr8 program is YAC. has malware detection, junk cleanup, system optimizer, ad blocker, program uninstaller and a deep clean after un-installing to get rid of any residue
replies.body_tagged: a gr8 program is YAC. has malware detection, junk cleanup, system optimizer, ad blocker, program uninstaller and a deep clean after un-installing to get rid of any residue
